implementation.connectivity: Connect to the TXD output of the external UART device or RS232/RS422/RS485 level converter. This pin receives serial data from the external device to be transmitted over USB to the host.
implementation.detailed_description: The RXD pin is the UART receive data input. Data received on this pin is buffered in the internal 512-byte TX FIFO and sent to the USB host. The pin is pulled to VCCIO via an internal 75 kohm resistor.
implementation.functionality: Receives asynchronous serial data from an external UART device. Supports 7 or 8 data bits, 1 or 2 stop bits, and various parity options.
precautions: Input is 5V tolerant when powered from VCCIO.
During USB suspend, this pin can be configured to pull low via MTP memory settings.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert RXD option in MTP memory.

RI#.name: RI#
RI#.description: Ring Indicator input for remote wake up. Active low.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the ring indicator signal from a modem or leave unconnected if not used (internal pull-up will hold high). Taking RI# low will wake the USB host from suspend.
implementation.detailed_description: Ring Indicator control input. Active low signal used for modem handshaking and USB remote wakeup functionality.
implementation.functionality: Indicates an incoming ring signal. Also used to trigger USB remote wake up from suspend mode.
precautions: Active low signal. Internal pull-up to VCCIO ensures safe default state.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert RI# option in MTP memory.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to system ground plane. Both GND pins (3 and 13) must be connected.
implementation.detailed_description: Power supply ground reference for the device.
implementation.functionality: Provides the ground reference for all internal circuitry.
precautions: Ensure low-impedance connection to ground plane.
Both GND pins must be connected for proper operation.

DSR#.name: DSR#
DSR#.description: Data Set Ready Control Input / Handshake Signal. Active low.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the DSR# output of the remote device or RS232 level converter. Leave unconnected if handshaking is not required.
implementation.detailed_description: Data Set Ready input for modem handshaking. Active low. Paired with DTR# for DSR/DTR handshaking.
implementation.functionality: Indicates the remote device is ready for communication. Used in DSR/DTR hardware handshaking.
precautions: Internal pull-up to VCCIO holds pin high (inactive) when unconnected.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert DSR# option in MTP memory.

DCD#.name: DCD#
DCD#.description: Data Carrier Detect Control Input. Active low.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the DCD# output of the remote device or RS232 level converter. Leave unconnected if not used.
implementation.detailed_description: Data Carrier Detect input. Active low. Indicates the presence of a carrier signal from the remote device.
implementation.functionality: Reports carrier detection status to the USB host application.
precautions: Internal pull-up to VCCIO holds pin high (inactive) when unconnected.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert DCD# option in MTP memory.

CTS#.name: CTS#
CTS#.description: Clear To Send Control Input / Handshake Signal. Active low.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the CTS# output of the remote device or RS232 level converter. For RTS/CTS hardware flow control, connect to the remote device's RTS# output.
implementation.detailed_description: Clear To Send input for RTS/CTS hardware flow control. Active low. When asserted (low), the FT231X is permitted to transmit data on TXD.
implementation.functionality: Controls UART data flow from the FT231X to the remote device. When CTS# is de-asserted (high), the FT231X pauses data transmission.
precautions: Internal pull-up to VCCIO holds pin high when unconnected, which will pause transmission if flow control is enabled.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert CTS# option in MTP memory.
Handshaking is handled in hardware for fast response times.

CBUS2.name: CBUS2
CBUS2.description: Configurable CBUS I/O Pin. Default configuration is TXLED# (transmit data LED drive, active low).

implementation.connectivity: Connect to an LED (via current limiting resistor) for transmit activity indication, or configure for other CBUS functions via MTP memory. Default function is TXLED#.
implementation.detailed_description: Configurable CBUS I/O pin. Function is set in the MTP memory. Available functions include: TRI-STATE, DRIVE 1, DRIVE 0, TXDEN, PWREN#, TXLED#, RXLED#, TX&RXLED#, SLEEP#, CLK24MHz, CLK12MHz, CLK6MHz, GPIO, BCD Charger, BCD Charger#, BitBang_WR#, BitBang_RD#, VBUS_Sense, Time Stamp, Keep_Awake#.
implementation.functionality: Default: TXLED# - pulses low when data is transmitted on TXD (received from USB host). Can be reconfigured to other CBUS functions.
precautions: Function must be configured in MTP memory using FT_PROG utility.
Drive strength (4/8/12/16 mA), slew rate, and Schmitt trigger input are configurable in MTP memory.
Clock outputs (CLK24/12/6MHz) are suspended during USB suspend mode.

USBDP.name: USBDP
USBDP.description: USB Data Signal Plus. Requires a series 27 ohm resistor to USB connector.

connected_components.description: A 27 ohm series resistor is required between the USBDP pin and the USB connector D+ line for impedance matching.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the USB connector D+ pin via a 27 ohm series resistor. An internal 1.5 kohm pull-up resistor to 3V3OUT identifies the device as a USB Full Speed device.
implementation.detailed_description: USB Data Plus signal. Part of the differential USB data pair. Includes an internal 1.5 kohm pull-up resistor to 3V3OUT for full-speed device identification.
implementation.functionality: Carries the positive USB differential data signal. Used for USB 2.0 Full Speed (12 Mbps) communication.
precautions: Must use a 27 ohm series resistor to the USB connector.
Do not exceed absolute maximum voltage rating of 3.63V.
Route as a controlled impedance differential pair with USBDM.
Keep trace lengths matched and as short as possible.

USBDM.name: USBDM
USBDM.description: USB Data Signal Minus. Requires a series 27 ohm resistor to USB connector.

connected_components.description: A 27 ohm series resistor is required between the USBDM pin and the USB connector D- line for impedance matching.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the USB connector D- pin via a 27 ohm series resistor.
implementation.detailed_description: USB Data Minus signal. Part of the differential USB data pair.
implementation.functionality: Carries the negative USB differential data signal. Used for USB 2.0 Full Speed (12 Mbps) communication.
precautions: Must use a 27 ohm series resistor to the USB connector.
Do not exceed absolute maximum voltage rating of 3.63V.
Route as a controlled impedance differential pair with USBDP.
Keep trace lengths matched and as short as possible.

3V3OUT.name: 3V3OUT
3V3OUT.description: 3.3V LDO regulator output at 50mA. May be used to power VCCIO. When VCC is 3V3, pin 10 is an input pin and should be connected to pin 12 (VCC).

connected_components.description: An external 100nF decoupling capacitor is required on the 3V3OUT pin to ground.

implementation.connectivity: Connect a 100nF decoupling capacitor from 3V3OUT to GND. Can optionally be connected to VCCIO to power the I/O cells at 3.3V. When VCC is 3.3V, this pin becomes an input and must be connected to VCC.
implementation.detailed_description: Output of the internal 3.3V LDO regulator. Provides 3.3V at up to 50mA. Also provides power to the internal 1.5 kohm USB pull-up resistor on USBDP and the USB transceiver.
implementation.functionality: Provides regulated 3.3V output from the internal LDO. Primary purpose is powering the USB transceiver and reset generator. Can supply external circuitry up to 50mA.
precautions: Maximum output current is 50mA. Do not exceed this limit.
When VCC is 3.3V, this pin must be connected to VCC (pin 12) as an input.
Always requires a 100nF decoupling capacitor to ground.
VCC must be greater than 3V3OUT voltage, otherwise 3V3OUT becomes an input.

RESET#.name: RESET#
RESET#.description: Reset input. Active low. Can be tied to VCCIO if not used.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to VCCIO if external reset is not required. The device has an integrated power-on-reset circuit. For external reset control, drive low to reset the device.
implementation.detailed_description: Active low reset input. An internal power-on-reset circuit is integrated, so external reset is optional. When reset is asserted, all UART I/O pins are tri-stated.
implementation.functionality: Resets the device when driven low. Internal power-on-reset provides automatic reset at power-up.
precautions: Can be tied to VCCIO if external reset is not needed.
When the FT231X is in reset, UART interface I/O pins are tri-stated with internal 200 kohm pull-ups to VCCIO.
Active low signal.

VCC.name: VCC
VCC.description: 5V or 3V3 supply to IC. Main power input.

connected_components.description: A 100nF decoupling capacitor should be placed close to the VCC pin to ground.
For USB bus-powered designs, a ferrite bead in series with the USB VBUS to VCC is recommended for EMI reduction.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to 5V USB VBUS (bus-powered) or external 3.3V-5.25V supply (self-powered). Place 100nF decoupling capacitor close to pin.
implementation.detailed_description: Main power supply input for the FT231X. Supplies power to the internal LDO regulators and core logic.
implementation.functionality: Provides main power to the device. Acceptable voltage range is 2.97V to 5.5V. When operated at 3.3V, the 3V3OUT pin must also be driven with 3.3V.
precautions: Do not exceed absolute maximum of 5.5V.
When VCC is 3.3V, pin 10 (3V3OUT) must be connected to VCC.
Place decoupling capacitor as close to pin as possible.
For bus-powered designs, use ferrite bead in series with USB VBUS.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to system ground plane. Both GND pins (3 and 13) must be connected.
implementation.detailed_description: Power supply ground reference for the device.
implementation.functionality: Provides the ground reference for all internal circuitry.
precautions: Ensure low-impedance connection to ground plane.
Both GND pins must be connected for proper operation.

CBUS1.name: CBUS1
CBUS1.description: Configurable CBUS I/O Pin. Default configuration is RXLED# (receive data LED drive, active low).

implementation.connectivity: Connect to an LED (via current limiting resistor) for receive activity indication, or configure for other CBUS functions via MTP memory. Default function is RXLED#.
implementation.detailed_description: Configurable CBUS I/O pin. Function is set in the MTP memory. See CBUS2 for full list of available functions.
implementation.functionality: Default: RXLED# - pulses low when data is received from USB host and transmitted on TXD. Can be reconfigured to other CBUS functions.
precautions: Function must be configured in MTP memory using FT_PROG utility.
Drive strength, slew rate, and Schmitt trigger input are configurable.

CBUS0.name: CBUS0
CBUS0.description: Configurable CBUS I/O Pin. Default configuration is TXDEN (transmit data enable for RS485).

implementation.connectivity: For RS485 applications, connect to the DE (Driver Enable) pin of the RS485 transceiver. For other uses, configure via MTP memory. Default function is TXDEN.
implementation.detailed_description: Configurable CBUS I/O pin. Function is set in the MTP memory. See CBUS2 for full list of available functions.
implementation.functionality: Default: TXDEN - Transmit Data Enable output for RS485 transceiver control. Active high when the FT231X is transmitting data. Can be reconfigured to other CBUS functions.
precautions: Function must be configured in MTP memory using FT_PROG utility.
Drive strength, slew rate, and Schmitt trigger input are configurable.

CBUS3.name: CBUS3
CBUS3.description: Configurable CBUS I/O Pin. Default configuration is SLEEP# (logic low during USB suspend).

implementation.connectivity: For USB-to-RS232 designs, connect to the SHDN# pin of an RS232 level converter to power it down during USB suspend. For other uses, configure via MTP memory. Default function is SLEEP#.
implementation.detailed_description: Configurable CBUS I/O pin. Function is set in the MTP memory. See CBUS2 for full list of available functions.
implementation.functionality: Default: SLEEP# - Goes low during USB suspend mode. Typically used to power down an external TTL to RS232 level converter IC. Can be reconfigured to other CBUS functions.
precautions: Function must be configured in MTP memory using FT_PROG utility.
Drive strength, slew rate, and Schmitt trigger input are configurable.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the RXD input of the external UART device or RS232/RS422/RS485 level converter. This pin transmits serial data received from the USB host.
implementation.detailed_description: UART transmit data output. Data received from the USB host is buffered in the 512-byte RX FIFO and output serially on this pin.
implementation.functionality: Outputs asynchronous serial data to the external UART device. Supports 7 or 8 data bits, 1 or 2 stop bits, and various parity options. Data rates from 300 baud to 3 Mbaud.
precautions: Output level is referenced to VCCIO.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert TXD option in MTP memory.
Drive strength is configurable: 4mA (default), 8mA, 12mA, or 16mA.

DTR#.name: DTR#
DTR#.description: Data Terminal Ready Control Output / Handshake Signal. Active low.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the DTR# input of the remote device or RS232 level converter. Used as part of DSR/DTR hardware handshaking.
implementation.detailed_description: Data Terminal Ready output for modem handshaking. Active low. Paired with DSR# for DSR/DTR handshaking.
implementation.functionality: Indicates that the FT231X (terminal) is ready for communication. Controlled by the USB host application.
precautions: Output level is referenced to VCCIO.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert DTR# option in MTP memory.

RTS#.name: RTS#
RTS#.description: Request to Send Control Output / Handshake Signal. Active low.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the CTS# input of the remote device or RS232 level converter. Used as part of RTS/CTS hardware flow control.
implementation.detailed_description: Request To Send output for RTS/CTS hardware flow control. Active low. When asserted (low), the FT231X requests to send data.
implementation.functionality: Controls UART data flow from the remote device to the FT231X. Part of the RTS/CTS handshaking pair. Handshaking is handled in hardware for fast response.
precautions: Output level is referenced to VCCIO.
Signal can be inverted by setting the Invert RTS# option in MTP memory.

VCCIO.name: VCCIO
VCCIO.description: 1.8V to 3.3V supply for the IO cells. Sets the I/O voltage level for all UART and CBUS pins.

connected_components.description: A 100nF decoupling capacitor should be placed close to the VCCIO pin to ground.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to the desired I/O voltage rail (1.8V, 2.5V, or 3.3V). Can be connected to the 3V3OUT pin for 3.3V I/O operation. Place 100nF decoupling capacitor close to pin.
implementation.detailed_description: I/O power supply for all UART and CBUS output buffers. Determines the output high voltage level and the input threshold levels. Separate from VCC to allow level-shifted I/O.
implementation.functionality: Sets the I/O voltage level for UART interface and CBUS pins. Allows interfacing with 1.8V, 2.5V, or 3.3V logic without external level translators.
precautions: VCCIO range is 1.62V to 3.63V. Do not exceed absolute maximum of 4.0V.
VCCIO should not be powered down when using PWREN# for power switching of external logic.
I/O pin characteristics (thresholds, drive strength) vary with VCCIO voltage.
Place decoupling capacitor as close to pin as possible.

GND_PAD.name: GND (Exposed Pad)
GND_PAD.description: Exposed pad on the bottom of the QFN package. Must be connected to GND.

implementation.connectivity: Connect the exposed pad to the system ground plane. Use multiple vias under the pad for thermal and electrical connection.
implementation.detailed_description: The exposed pad on the bottom of the QFN-20 package provides the primary thermal path and ground connection.
implementation.functionality: Ground and thermal pad. Provides enhanced thermal dissipation and ground connection.
precautions: Must be soldered to the PCB ground plane.
Use thermal vias under the pad for best thermal performance.
This pad is present only on the QFN package variant.
